title: How to Make Chocolate Covered Banana Chips

steps.headline: Have the banana thinly sliced and then get a microwave-safe bowl and place the smooth-and-melty chocolate chips in the bowl.
steps.description: Melt the pieces in the microwave for 10 second intervals, stopping to stir, until they are smooth and shiny.

steps.headline: Cover about 3/4 of a banana slice with chocolate, using a cream stick or the end of a spoon.
steps.description: Repeat for the rest of the banana chips.

steps.headline: Freeze the finished chips for about 2 hours or until the chocolate has hardened.
Cover a dessert cup (like the kind used for strawberry shortcake) with whipped cream if you want to, and place the choco-banana chips on top... yum!

text: Gather your ingredients.  Have the banana thinly sliced and then get a microwave-safe bowl and place the smooth-and-melty chocolate chips in the bowl. Melt the pieces in the microwave for 10 second intervals, stopping to stir, until they are smooth and shiny. Cover about 3/4 of a banana slice with chocolate, using a cream stick or the end of a spoon. Repeat for the rest of the banana chips. Freeze the finished chips for about 2 hours or until the chocolate has hardened.  Cover a dessert cup (like the kind used for strawberry shortcake) with whipped cream if you want to, and place the choco-banana chips on top... yum!
